intro: Rhabdotheca korovinii, commonly known as the Korovin's rhabdotheca, is a rare and specialized plant species native to the high-altitude regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes many aromatic and medicinal plants. The plant is characterized by its slender, branching stems and small, greenish-white flowers that bloom in clusters. It thrives in cold, arid environments and is adapted to survive in harsh mountainous conditions. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
